stories.text: An argument that is technically victorious would conclusively disprove or render indefensible an opposing claim. But that doesn't make a "winning" argument in the sense of one that wins over other people, even among the most rational individuals. Why is a logical and sound argument not sufficient enough to convince others? What does it take for such an argument to win?
stories.title: Ask HN: What Makes a Winning Argument?
